title: Bug 6410: File unchanged but dirtied by code assist
description: While using code assist in a Java file, the file is marked as dirty even though no changes have been made.
OB: When using code assist in a Java file, the file is marked as dirty even though no changes have been made.
EB: The file should not be marked as dirty when using code assist if no changes have been made.
SR:
1. Open a Java file.
2. Place the cursor inside the leftmost parenthesis of a method call.
3. For example, consider "I" to be the cursor below:
   Object o = anotherObject.method(I);
4. Press Ctrl+Space to invoke code assist.
